problems.stem: Which of the following is a two-force member?
options: A beam with a uniformly distributed load
A truss member connected by pins at both ends with no intermediate loads
A cantilever beam with an end load
A column supporting a moment at the top
problems.explanation: A two-force member has forces applied at only two points and no moments. A truss member with pins at both ends and no other loads fits this definition exactly.

problems.stem: A rigid body is acted upon by exactly three forces and is in equilibrium. If two of the forces are not parallel, what must be true about all three forces?
problems.expected_answer: They must be concurrent (pass through a single common point)
problems.explanation: For three non-parallel coplanar forces to be in equilibrium, they must all pass through a common point. This is necessary to satisfy the moment equilibrium condition.

problems.stem: In a simple truss, member AB connects joints A and B, which are 2 meters apart. If the internal force in member AB is 5000 N compression, what is the force component in the direction from A to B?
hints: In a two-force member, the force acts along the line connecting the two pin joints
Compression means the member is pushing outward from the joint
The magnitude is simply the given force value
